response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Object>> it = map.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    Map.Entry<String, Object> entry = it.next();
    if(entry.getValue() instanceof List){
        List<?> list = (List<?>) entry.getValue();
        list.remove(k);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can remove any k elements from a map without iterating by using the remove() method of the List interface on the values of the map. If the value is a list, you can remove the kth element by using the get(k) method and then calling the remove() method on the list.
